title: Gospel Harmonies: 7th Chords Mastery
description: Deep dive into Major 7th, Minor 7th, and Dominant 7th chords that form the foundation of Gospel sound.

sections.title: The Church Sound
sections.content: Gospel music relies on the rich, full sound of 7th chords. Unlike pop music's simpler triads, gospel embraces extended harmony.
key_points: These create the characteristic warm, soulful tone

sections.title: Voice Leading Principles
sections.content: Smooth voice leading is crucial in gospel piano.
key_points: Approach non-common tones by step when possible

title: The Preacher's Chord: Dominant 7#9
description: Master the iconic dominant 7#9 (Jimi Hendrix/Preacher chord) used for dramatic Gospel shouts and accents.

sections.title: Anatomy of the 7#9
sections.content: The 7#9 chord contains a tritone (diminished 5th) that creates tension and drama.
key_points: The tritone between G# and D creates the edgy sound
Perfect for Gospel shouts and climactic moments

title: Gospel Walk-ups and Walk-downs
description: Create movement and drive in your gospel playing with bass line walk-ups and walk-downs.

sections.title: Creating Bass Movement
sections.content: Gospel music loves chromatic bass motion that propels the music forward.
key_points: Walk from chord roots using chromatic passing tones
Create predictable patterns that listeners anticipate
Use quarter notes or eighths for energy
Common in uptempo Gospel and Praise & Worship

title: The 7-3-6 Progression
description: One of Gospel's most iconic progressions: the relative minor resolution that defines many Gospel classics.

sections.title: Anatomy of 7-3-6
sections.content: This progression creates dramatic harmonic movement.
key_points: 3 = III chord (secondary dominant to relative minor)

title: Gospel Rhythmic Patterns and Grooves
description: Authentic Gospel piano rhythms that drive the music and engage the congregation.

sections.title: The Gospel Swing Feel
sections.content: Gospel doesn't use strict timing; it swings and syncopates.
key_points: Use syncopated rhythms to engage listeners

title: Extended Gospel Chords: 9ths, 11ths, 13ths
description: Go beyond 7th chords and learn the rich extended voicings that create lush Gospel harmonies.

sections.title: Adding Extensions
sections.content: Extended chords add color and sophistication to Gospel harmonies.

title: Gospel Left Hand Techniques
description: Master left hand patterns from simple shell voicings to complex bass movements.

sections.title: Shell Voicings for Left Hand
sections.content: Efficient left hand voicings that leave space for right hand melody.
key_points: Allows room for right hand flourishes

title: Gospel Right Hand Ornamentation
description: Add soulful flourishes, grace notes, and call-and-response patterns with your right hand.

sections.title: Decorating the Harmony
sections.content: Gospel pianists ornament chords with decorative techniques.
key_points: These should feel organic, not mechanical

title: Gospel Comping: Playing Behind the Soloist
description: Learn to comp (accompany) singers and other musicians with responsive, supportive Gospel piano.

sections.title: The Art of Comping
sections.content: Gospel comping is a conversation with the soloist.
key_points: Listen carefully to what the soloist is singing
Leave space for vocal breath and interpretation

title: Gospel Passing Chords and Secondary Dominants
description: Add sophistication with passing chords that create smooth harmonic transitions.

sections.title: Filling Harmonic Space
sections.content: Passing chords create movement between main chords.
key_points: Diminished passing chords smooth voice leading

title: Shell Voicings: The Foundation of Jazz Piano
description: Master the most efficient and elegant voicing system used by all jazz pianists.

sections.title: What is a Shell?
sections.content: A shell voicing contains only three essential notes: root, 3rd, and 7th.
key_points: Perfect for both left and right hand

title: Guide Tone Lines in Jazz Standards
description: Create smooth melodic lines using only the 3rds and 7ths of chord changes.

sections.title: The Power of Guide Tones
sections.content: 3rds and 7ths define the character of chords and create smooth voice leading.
key_points: 3rd tells us if chord is major or minor
7th determines major, minor, or dominant quality
These can move in small intervals

title: The ii-V-I Progression: Jazz's Most Important Pattern
description: Master the progression that appears in 80% of jazz standards.

sections.title: The Foundation of Jazz Harmony
sections.content: Every jazz musician must internalize the ii-V-I.
key_points: Learn in all 12 keys until automatic

title: Jazz Improvisation: Using Chord Tones (1-3-5-7)
description: Begin soloing by outlining chords with their four primary tones.

sections.title: Chord Tone Soloing
sections.content: The safest and most musical way to start improvising.
key_points: Land on character notes on strong beats

title: Approach Notes and Enclosures
description: Add chromaticism to your solo by approaching target notes from above or below.

sections.title: Adding Spice to Your Solo
sections.content: Approach notes create sophisticated, vocal-like phrasing.
key_points: Enclosures (surrounding a target from both sides)

title: Tritone Substitution: Reharmonizing V Chords
description: Swap out dominant chords with their tritone substitutes to create sophisticated reharmonizations.

sections.title: The Magic of Tritones
sections.content: Two chords a tritone apart can substitute for each other.
key_points: G7 can be replaced by Db7 (tritone apart)
Creates chromatic bass line when substituted

title: Jazz Blues Changes and Soloing
description: Understand the chord progression of jazz blues and create sophisticated solos over blues changes.

sections.title: The Jazz Blues Form
sections.content: Jazz blues extends the standard 12-bar blues with sophisticated changes.

title: Coltrane Changes: Advanced Harmonic Substitution
description: Master the legendary substitution technique that transformed jazz improvisation.

sections.title: What are Coltrane Changes?
sections.content: John Coltrane revolutionized soloing with rapid chord substitutions.
key_points: Replace a single chord with a ii-V-I progression
Creates harmonic richness and forward motion
Requires fast thinking and finger movement

title: Comping Patterns: Left Hand Accompaniment
description: Learn the essential left hand patterns for comping chords in jazz.

sections.title: The Art of Comping
sections.content: Supporting the band requires rhythmic sensitivity and harmonic knowledge.
key_points: Space is as important as notes

title: Swing Feel and Jazz Rhythms
description: Master the rhythmic foundation that makes jazz swing and feel alive.

sections.title: What Makes It Swing?
sections.content: Swing is about feel, not just technique.

title: Reharmonization Techniques for Standards
description: Transform familiar jazz standards by reimagining their harmonic progressions.

sections.title: Making Standards Your Own
sections.content: Great jazz musicians create their own versions of standards.
key_points: Maintain harmonic integrity while being creative

title: The 12-Bar Blues Progression
description: Master the foundation of American music: the classic 12-bar blues.

sections.title: The Classic Form
sections.content: The 12-bar blues has been the foundation of countless songs.
key_points: I7 (4 bars), IV7 (2 bars), I7 (2 bars)
V7 (2 bars), IV7 (1 bar), I7 (1 bar)

title: Blues Scales and Soloing
description: Learn the pentatonic and blues scales that define the blues sound.

sections.title: The Blues Scale
sections.content: The blues scale is the most soulful scale in Western music.
key_points: Works over major or minor contexts
Foundation of blues, rock, and funk soloing

title: Blues Turnarounds and Endings
description: Create exciting conclusions to blues phrases and choruses with turnarounds.

sections.title: Turning the Corner
sections.content: Turnarounds signal the end of a phrase and prepare for the next.
key_points: Usually occur in the last 1-2 bars
Lead back to the I chord

title: Bent Notes and Blues Expression
description: Add emotional depth with string bending, vibrato, and other expressive techniques.

sections.title: The Human Element
sections.content: Blues is about emotion and expression, not just notes.
key_points: Bent notes approach pitches rather than hitting them

title: Boogie Woogie: Blues Piano Patterns
description: Master the hypnotic left-hand patterns that define boogie woogie and blues piano.

sections.title: The Hypnotic Groove
sections.content: Boogie woogie uses repeated left-hand patterns that drive the music.

title: Quick Change in Blues
description: Add variety to your blues playing with the classic quick change IV-I movement.

sections.title: Breaking the Pattern
sections.content: The quick change adds freshness to repeated blues forms.
key_points: Brief movement to IV in the second bar of I7

title: Call and Response in Blues
description: The fundamental musical conversation of blues: trading phrases between musicians.

sections.title: The Blues Conversation
sections.content: Blues is fundamentally about musical conversation.
key_points: Foundation of all blues and jazz interaction

title: The Minor 11th: Neo-Soul's Signature Chord
description: Master the rich, extended chord that defines the Neo-Soul sound.

sections.title: The Lush Sound
sections.content: The minor 11th chord is the cornerstone of Neo-Soul.
key_points: Root, minor 3rd, perfect 5th, minor 7th, major 9th, perfect 11th
Signature of artists like D'Angelo and Erykah Badu

title: Neo-Soul Cluster Voicings
description: Create the signature stacked voicings that make Neo-Soul sound modern and sophisticated.

sections.title: Stacked Harmony
sections.content: Neo-Soul uses modern voicing techniques that stack chords in clusters.

title: Tritone Substitution in Neo-Soul
description: Reharmonize progressions with tritone substitutions for smooth, chromatic movement.

sections.title: Smooth Voice Leading
sections.content: Tritone substitutions create hypnotic chromatic bass movement.

title: The 'Dilla' Feel: Behind-the-Beat Timing
description: Master the laid-back, almost drunk feel that defines J Dilla's influence on Neo-Soul.

sections.title: Intentional Imprecision
sections.content: The beauty of Neo-Soul is playing subtly behind the beat.
key_points: Deliberately lag behind the strict tempo
Signature of modern R&B and Soul

title: Extended Pentatonic and Modal Scales in Neo-Soul
description: Explore the modal scales and pentatonic variations that give Neo-Soul its distinctive color.

sections.title: Colorful Scales
sections.content: Neo-Soul uses sophisticated scales to create emotional depth.

title: Neo-Soul Grace Notes, Slides, and Legato
description: Add soulful expression with slides, grace notes, and legato playing techniques.

sections.title: Vocal Technique on Keys
sections.content: Neo-Soul pianists play like vocalists, with slides and grace notes.

title: Reharmonization: Making Simple Progressions Complex
description: Transform basic chord progressions into lush, sophisticated Neo-Soul arrangements.

sections.title: Adding Depth
sections.content: Great Neo-Soul artists take simple ideas and make them sophisticated.

title: Neo-Soul Rhythmic Patterns and Grooves
description: Master the rhythmic foundation that makes Neo-Soul groove and feel alive.

sections.title: The Rhythmic Foundation
sections.content: Neo-Soul rhythm is contemporary, syncopated, and groove-oriented.

title: Comping in Neo-Soul: Space and Texture
description: Learn to comp (accompany) with spacious, textural voicings that support rather than dominate.

sections.title: The Art of Accompaniment
sections.content: Neo-Soul comping is about texture and space as much as notes.

title: Contemporary Chord Progressions in Neo-Soul
description: Explore the modern progressions that define contemporary Neo-Soul and R&B.

sections.title: The Modern Sound
sections.content: Contemporary Neo-Soul uses progressions that break traditional rules.

title: The Major Scale: Foundation of Classical Music
description: Understand the foundation of Western music theory and composition.

sections.title: The 12 Major Scales
sections.content: Every major scale follows the same pattern: W-W-H-W-W-W-H

title: Harmonic Analysis: Roman Numeral Notation
description: Learn the analytical system used to understand Classical harmony and structure.

sections.title: The Language of Analysis
sections.content: Roman numerals describe harmonic function and relationship.

title: Four-Part Harmony and Voice Leading
description: Master the rules of Classical voice leading for four-part harmony.

sections.title: The Rules of Harmony
sections.content: Classical music follows strict voice leading principles.

title: Cadences: The Punctuation of Classical Music
description: Understand the classical cadences that provide harmonic closure and structure.

sections.title: Harmonic Punctuation
sections.content: Cadences function like punctuation marks in music.

title: Modulation: Changing Keys
description: Learn techniques for moving between keys in Classical compositions.

sections.title: Harmonic Travel
sections.content: Modulation allows composers to explore different harmonic areas.

title: The Sonata Form: Classical Structure
description: Understand the fundamental form of Classical composition.

sections.title: The Classical Blueprint
sections.content: Sonata form is the backbone of Classical and early Romantic composition.
key_points: Exposition: theme areas in different keys

title: Baroque Ornamentation: Trills, Turns, and Mordents
description: Master the ornamental techniques that embellish Baroque and Classical music.

sections.title: Decorative Flourishes
sections.content: Baroque composers used standardized ornaments to enhance melodies.
key_points: Trill: rapid alternation between two notes

title: Counterpoint: The Art of Simultaneous Melodies
description: Learn the techniques for creating independent melodic lines that work together.

sections.title: Musical Conversation
sections.content: Counterpoint creates musical depth through independent voices.
key_points: Contrary motion (lines move in opposite directions)
Oblique motion (one line stays, other moves)

title: Fugal Form and Imitation
description: Understand the highest form of counterpoint: the fugue.

sections.title: The King of Forms
sections.content: The fugue represents the apex of contrapuntal technique.
key_points: Exposition: subject introduced in each voice

title: Chord Inversions and Voice Leading
description: Master the use of chord inversions to create smooth, singable lines.

sections.title: Beyond Root Position
sections.content: Inversions allow chords to appear in different forms.

title: Intervals: The Building Blocks of Music
description: Understand intervals and their relationships, essential for all music.

sections.title: Measuring Distance in Music
sections.content: Intervals measure the distance between two pitches.

title: Chord Construction: From Triads to Extended Voicings
description: Learn how to build any chord from root up.

sections.title: Building Blocks of Harmony
sections.content: All chords are built by stacking intervals.

title: Diatonic Harmony: Chords from Scales
description: Learn which chords naturally occur in a given scale.

sections.title: Harmony from the Scale
sections.content: Every scale contains its own set of chords.
key_points: Build triads on each scale degree
C Major: Cmaj, Dm, Em, Fmaj, G7, Am, Bdim

title: Secondary Dominants: Expanding Harmonic Vocabulary
description: Learn to create temporary dominant chords to any scale degree.

sections.title: Mini Modulations
sections.content: Secondary dominants temporarily treat any chord as a tonic.

title: Functional Harmony: Why Chords Do What They Do
description: Understand why certain chords resolve to others and how harmony creates meaning.

sections.title: The Language of Harmony
sections.content: Harmony is a language with grammar and meaning.

title: Chromatic Harmony: Color and Expression
description: Use chromatic passing tones, embellishing tones, and chromatic chords for color.

sections.title: Adding Color
sections.content: Chromatic harmony adds sophistication and color.
key_points: Chromatic chords for color and effect

title: Ear Training: Developing Your Musical Ear
description: Build fundamental ear training skills for interval, chord, and rhythm recognition.

sections.title: Listening Skills
sections.content: Your ear is a muscle that improves with practice.
key_points: Progress to triads and seventh chords

title: Rhythm and Meter: The Foundation of Timing
description: Master rhythm notation and understand how meter organizes music.

sections.title: The Pulse of Music
sections.content: Rhythm organizes musical time.
key_points: Whole, half, quarter, eighth, sixteenth notes
Common time (4/4), waltz time (3/4), cut time (2/2)

title: Transposition: Playing in All Keys
description: Learn transposition techniques to adapt music to different keys.

sections.title: Moving Keys
sections.content: Transposition maintains relationships while changing keys.

title: Scales Beyond Major: Modes and Exotic Scales
description: Explore modes and other scale systems that expand harmonic possibilities.

sections.title: Modal Exploration
sections.content: Modes are rotations of major scales with unique qualities.

title: Harmonic vs. Melodic Minor: Two Flavors
description: Understand the differences and uses of harmonic and melodic minor scales.

sections.title: Minor Scale Variations
sections.content: Minor scales come in two common forms with different characters.
key_points: Each has specific uses and sounds

title: Voice Leading Rules: From Basics to Advanced
description: Master the fundamental principles that make music singable and smooth.

sections.title: Making Music Smooth
sections.content: Good voice leading creates singable, elegant music.
key_points: Keep notes as close as possible
